intro: Pouzolzia parietarioides, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and arid environments. It is known for its ability to withstand drought and salt spray, making it a hardy species. The flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences and bloom in late spring to early summer.
